alert.note: Alert for Chase (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 11:32PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Chase County through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1131 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Burdick, or 13 miles northeast of Marion, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood Falls, Strong City, Bazaar, Elmdale, Cedar Point, Hymer, Saffordville, Tallgrass Prairie and Tallgrass Prairie Preserve. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 106 and 115. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for central and east central Kansas.
